hypothesis_content.title: PEPE Multi-Timeframe Momentum Convergence
hypothesis_content.statement: For the high-liquidity memecoin PEPE, a specific multi-timeframe momentum alignment (4h RSI(14) > 55, 1h MACD histogram turning positive, and 15m price > VWAP) during NEUTRAL or BULL regimes provides a high-probability signal for a short-term continuation move of 8-12% within the next 24-36 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: PEPE has mature market structure with significant institutional and whale interest. Momentum moves are often methodical. Alignment across short-term timeframes (15m, 1h, 4h) indicates coordinated buying pressure across different trader cohorts, reducing the risk of a false breakout. This convergence often precedes a short, sharp rally as late momentum buyers FOMO in.
entry_conditions: PEPE 1h MACD histogram > prior histogram (turning positive)
BTC 4h trend is not strongly negative (price > 4h MA50)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Position reaches -5% return OR 1h MACD histogram turns negative

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The setup triggers but price immediately reverses, breaking below the 15m VWAP and failing to achieve >3% gain within 12 hours, indicating a failed momentum squeeze.
